Orange is the new Red: Is Trump America's most Left-leaning president?
description: Critics often call him a right-wing white supremacist nationalist and, much like the Holy Roman Empire, none of those descriptors are remotely accurate. He’s not right-wing, not a white supremacist, and not even nationalist. Trump doesn’t care about race at all, not in the way people think. He’s barely nationalist and will always put his own self-interest ahead of the nation’s. And right-wing? He’s the most left-leaning POTUS, so much so that if McCarthy were around today, he would blacklist him.

The squeeze play: How BJP is shrinking space for regional parties - decoded
description: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) is strategically shrinking the political space for regional parties across India. Recent election results in Maharashtra, Bihar, and Uttar Pradesh demonstrate the BJP's success in weakening rivals through fragmentation, welfare schemes, and narrative control. While regional parties persist, their ability to translate state power into national influence has significantly diminished.

title: 5 takeaways from Donald Trump's threatening letter to Norway PM
description: Trump’s line about no longer feeling obligated to think “purely of peace” has been read by some as emotional blackmail over the Nobel Prize. That misses the point. Trump is not rejecting peace as an outcome. He is rejecting peace as a constraint.

title: Video allegedly showing Karnataka DGP Ramachandra Rao in compromising situation with woman sparks row; ‘fake clip’, he says
'Fabricated': K'taka DGP after 'compromising' video goes viral; CM warns of action
description: Karnataka DGP K Ramachandra Rao faced scrutiny after a video allegedly showing him in a compromising position with women went viral. Rao denied the footage, calling it "fabricated and false." Chief minister Siddaramaiah and other officials promised strict action if wrongdoing was confirmed. Rao stated he would consult his lawyer and clarify the matter with authorities.

Allegedly gang-raped and left for dead in May 2023, her case remains unresolved with no attackers identified. Her death highlights the ongoing suffering and calls for justice for the community.

A 'golden' bid for dominance: Decoding Trump's Greenland grab; knock-out blow for Russia, China?
description: Donald Trump's renewed focus on Greenland, linked to his 'Golden Dome' missile defence proposal, signals a strategic shift.  This Arctic island is seen as vital for US national security, offering a crucial vantage point against Russia and China.  The ambitious 'Golden Dome' aims for near-invulnerability, sparking global concerns over strategic stability and the militarisation of space.

description: India’s climb up the income ladder was slow for decades, taking 60 years to move from low income to lower-middle income. Since then, growth has sharply accelerated, and a likely transition into the upper-middle-income category by around 2030.

Matthew Stafford’s wife, daughters wow Chicago in matching Rams outfits
description: Matthew Stafford and the Los Angeles Rams braved snowy Chicago for an NFC clash against the Bears. Despite an MVP-worthy season with 4,707 yards and 46 touchdowns, Stafford has never won the award. His wife Kelly and their four daughters cheered him on in matching custom Rams jackets, highlighting their family support as Stafford pursues his second Super Bowl in his 17th NFL season.

title: 'I chose it out of passion': Google founder Sergey Brin on studying computer science
description: Google co-founder Sergey Brin recently shared insights on the evolving value of higher education in the age of AI. He emphasized that passion and curiosity, rather than just credentials, drive success, even as AI capabilities grow. Brin also noted Google's shift towards hiring "self-taught stars" with proven skills over solely relying on traditional degrees.

title: Jeff Bezos’ ex-wife's donations questioned - What it revealed?
description: MacKenzie Scott's ex-wife, Jeff Bezos, has donated millions to the Solidaire Network, which funds groups facing FBI and congressional investigations for alleged Hamas ties. While Scott's donations are unrestricted, the network supports organizations like Students for Justice in Palestine. Scott has given billions to various causes, impacting diversity programs and higher education.

title: Roger Federer revisits Australian Open glory with wife Mirka and kids
description: Roger Federer returned to the 2026 Australian Open with his full family and shared emotional memories from Melbourne. The seven-time champion spoke about reliving past wins, watching old clips, and his children playing with his trophy. Federer also played an exhibition match, giving fans another special moment from the tennis legend.

title: Bill Belichick joins ESPN as UNC looks ahead after disappointing 4–8 season
description: Bill Belichick will appear on ESPN’s ACC Network broadcast of the College Football Playoff national championship game in South Florida. The TV role comes weeks after his first season as North Carolina’s head coach ended at 4–8. Belichick is also focused on recruiting, including adding quarterback Billy Edwards Jr. ahead of the Tar Heels’ April 12 spring game.

title: Larsa Pippen shuts down LiAngelo Ball dating rumors, ends gossip
description: Larsa Pippen has vehemently denied a viral deepfake rumor linking her to rapper LiAngelo Ball.  The AI-generated image, which depicted an intimate pose, caused a stir online. Pippen, currently dating basketball star Jeff Coby, urged fans to cease creating such fabricated content, emphasizing the distress it causes. She clarified her relationship status, putting an end to the baseless speculation.
